data.title: Hat Yai city centre spared from floods
data.description: Songkhla: Hat Yai

data.title: Wa State Army denies Thai border tension rumours
data.description: Myanmar

data.title: '3R Model' to help curb PM2.5
data.description: Thailand is looking to enhance farmers

data.title: Wa State Army denies border tension rumours
data.description: Myanmar

data.title: Drugs found, over 100 arrested in underwear at Bangkok hotel party
data.description: Police arrested more than 120 people wearing only underwear in a Bangkok hotel room where they were partying with narcotics early Sunday morning.

data.title: Thai singer dies after 3 massage sessions
data.description: A luk thung and mor lam singer died on Sunday morning after receiving three massage sessions, two of which involved neck massage, from a Thai shop in the northeastern province of Udon Thani.

data.title: Drug trafficker arrested in southern Thailand with assault rifle, speed pills
data.description: NAKHON SI THAMMARAT: A man, 39, was arrested in Thung Song district of this southern Thai province with an assault rifle, 95 bullets, and 111 speed pills. Police believe the man is a major drug dealer.

data.title: Temperatures to drop 1-4 degrees in most parts of Thailand
data.description: Temperatures in all areas of Thailand except the South will drop by 1-4 degrees Celsius early this week due to a high pressure system from China, according to the Meteorological Department.

data.title: Five arrested in central Thailand with 6.4m speed pills destined for South
data.description: PATHUM THANI: Police arrested five suspects at a rented house in Lam Luk Ka district of this central Thai province with 6.4 million methamphetamine pills en route for distribution in the South.

data.title: Five arrested with 6.4m speed pills destined for South
data.description: PATHUM THANI: Police arrested five suspects at a rented house in Lam Luk Ka district with 6.4 million methamphetamine pills that had yet to be distributed to the South.

data.title: Yala city mayor pushes flood prevention solutions, dam plans
data.description: The mayor of Yala city municipality, Pongsak Yingchoncharoen, has proposed guidelines to address long-term flood issues while revisiting long-standing proposals to construct the Krong Pinang and Kuemeng dams as part of flood prevention efforts.

data.title: Moroccan sought in Chiang Mai killing
data.description: Thai police have sought help from Interpol to arrest a  Moroccan  man suspected of murdering his girlfriend in Chiang Mai and fleeing the country.

data.title: Second cash handout ‘by end of February’
data.description: The second phase of the government’s 10,000-baht cash  handout  is expected in February, government spokesman Jirayu Houngsub assured on Saturday.

data.title: More media coverage of Mekong region urged
data.description: LHASA - Media outlets in six Greater Mekong Sub-Region (GMS) countries are being urged to help report stories about Lancang-Mekong nations to foster cooperation in the area.

data.title: Couple arrested for duping job seekers
data.description: Police have arrested a couple who allegedly duped job seekers into paying them 70,000 baht each to arrange  jobs overseas  but provided them with nothing but  fake documents .

data.title: American tourist electrocuted in Phuket
data.description: An American tourist was killed when he slipped on a wet sidewalk and was  electrocuted  by a faulty streetlight in  Phuket , authorities said on Friday.

data.title: 'No progress made' by Joint Technical Committee on Cambodia
data.description: The government has admitted that the establishment of a Joint Technical Committee (JTC) to negotiate with Cambodia on disputed maritime areas has not made any progress and is still in the process of being formed, according to Deputy Prime Minister Phumtham Wechayachai.

data.title: Thai crew members not yet released by Myanmar
data.description: Myanmar authorities have yet to release four Thai crew members, citing the need to follow proper procedures.

data.title: A charter change muddle
data.description: A charter change muddle

data.title: B7bn budget urged to stop farmers burning sugarcane
data.description: To curb PM2.5 pollution levels, the government has been urged to allocate a 7-billion-baht budget to encourage sugarcane farmers to harvest their crops while they are fresh rather than burn them.

data.title: Pheu Thai bill 'to curb coups'
data.description: The Pheu Thai Party has proposed a bill to amend the Defence Ministry Administration Act, which would reduce the military
